intro: Pyrenaria tawauensis, commonly known as the Tawau pyrenaria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows as an understory species, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its fruits are small berries that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
